title: Czech Republic: The Citi Club Program Celebrates Its Fifth Anniversary
summary: Prague - Benefit programs rewarding customers for their purchases have been popular and used for a long time, and not just in the Czech Republic. The Citi Club program, which offers the holders of all Citi payment cards discounts of up to 25 percent at selected merchants all over the Czech Republic is celebrating its fifth anniversary today. As of now, the Citi Club has more than 400 business partners present in more than 1,200 points of sale all over the country, and the number is growing every year with the program bringing partners new customers.
tag-1: Czech Republic: The Citi Club Program Celebrates Its Fifth Anniversary
tag-2: Prague – Benefit programs rewarding customers for their purchases have been popular and used for a long time, and not just in the Czech Republic. The Citi Club program, which offers the holders of all Citi payment cards discounts of up to 25 percent at selected merchants all over the Czech Republic is celebrating its fifth anniversary today. As of now, the Citi Club has more than 400 business partners present in more than 1,200 points of sale all over the country, and the number is growing every year with the program bringing partners new customers.
tag-3: "Program partners have been recruited from the retail, gastronomy and travel merchant categories since the launch of the program," says Andrea Klímová, Citi's Marketing Communication Manager, and adds: "Our goal this year is to extend our offer with discounts in the leisure segment, including theater tickets and discounts on fitness center membership."
tag-4: Since the program's launch in 2009, the number of business partners has grown from the initial 17 to more than 400 today. In addition to the Citi Club program for all Citi credit and debit card holders, Citi also offers benefits for the Gold credit and debit card holders through the Gold Club program. This includes a set of special benefits and discounts in the areas of catering, shopping, sports, travel, health, and body care.
tag-5: While the majority of Citi Club partners are located in Prague and the Central Bohemian Region, clients can find many offers in other regions as well. "For the future, our plan is to focus more on the quality of our partners whose products and services provide a true added value to our customers," Andrea Klímová says. "Of course, in our selection, we tend to focus on larger cities and popular tourist destinations," she adds.
tag-6: In the long-term perspective, the greatest amounts attributable to the Citi Club program have been spent in the retail segment where holders of Citi's payment cards enjoy discounts from merchants and service providers in the areas of clothing, shoes, fashion accessories, sports goods, eyewear and more. In 2013, the spending in the segment accounted for 61 percent of the total Citi Club spend.
tag-7: "Since the launch of our Citi Club partnership with Citi, the number of our customers paying with Citi payment cards has been increasing every year," says Stanislav Zíma, marketing manager at EXIM tours. "There were nearly 950 customers in 2013 which is almost 50 percent increase compared to the previous year."
tag-8: Citi customers perceive the Citi Club program as one of the most attractive of its kind in the Czech market in terms quality of the partner portfolio and the services offered, as well as its simplicity. The program is unique in that the holders of Citi payment cards obtain the discount immediately when they pay the merchant with their cards. The Citi Club program has saved Citi's clients CZK 44 million over the five years it has been running. Citi Club is currently becoming one of the cornerstones of Citi's marketing communication in the Czech Republic.
tag-9: Citi's clients in the Czech Republic saved a total of CZK 180 million on purchases made using Citi credit cards, excluding Citi Club discounts, in the last year alone. They received the discounts in the form of bonuses and rewards for purchases paid using a Citi credit card. Citi in the Czech Republic offers several types of credit cards that offer their holders attractive benefit programs involving a broad range of benefits that reflect the clients' needs.
